images.copyright: Female moose, Denali National Park, Alaska (© Cavan Images/Alamy)
images.title: A wild stare
images.caption: Moose, Denali National Park, Alaska
images.desc: Have you ever experienced the awe of seeing an Alaskan moose? The largest moose species, these creatures can weigh 1,400 pounds and reach heights of up to 6 feet at the shoulder. Male moose are called bulls, females are known as cows, and their young are referred to as calves. One thing that really sets moose apart is their incredible antlers, which are only sported by the males.
